abstract: Guo Shuqing, chairman of China Construction Bank, proposed in an interview with The Financial Times that “junk” bonds be introduced to China to give smaller private companies a new source of credit.
snippet: Guo Shuqing, chairman of China Construction Bank, proposed in an interview with The Financial Times that “junk” bonds be introduced to China to give smaller private companies a new source of credit.
lead_paragraph: “It may be a little radical,” Guo Shuqing, chairman of state controlled China Construction Bank, told The Financial Times, “but I think we should promote junk bonds in China.”
